champagneIvanKostine 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Function reference

    All functions

    already_vectorized()
    Define the function F of a glass of wine by using only vectorized operations
    benchmark1_results()
    Extract the results of the Benchmarks including the vectorized function
    benchmark_results()
    Extracting the result of our benchmarks
    curve_plots()
    Generic function to plot the results using the curve method
    func_apply()
    Evaluating F function by using base::sapply function
    func_for()
    Evaluating function F using for loop
    func_map()
    Evaluate function F by using purrr::map function for the values of X
    func_vectorize()
    Evaluating the function F using Vectorize
    generate_input()
    Generating the input size for the benchmarking
    glass_function()
    Defining function F representing the cut of a glass of wine
    integral_i()
    Integrate the function I
    integral_v()
    Integrate the function V (Volume of the Glass)
    math_expression_i()
    Computing the result of mathematical expression I
    math_expression_v()
    Computing the volume of the glass without using the integral
    optimize_result()
    Use optimize function to find the upper bound of our V function to have a volume of 0.2L
    plot_benchmark()
    Plotting the results of the benchmarks
    run_benchmarks()
    Run microbenchmark::microbenchmark for all the functions
    run_benchmarks1()
    Run the benchmark for all functions including the Vectorized function
    simulate_party()
    Generate the numeric values to create simulation of a party
    simulate_results()
    Evaluate the simulation and return plots of the results
    uniroot_result()
    Use uniroot to find the upper bound of the function V
    volume_function()
    Finding the upper bound of the Volume function needed to have integrate_v(10,b) = 0.2
    volume_function_optimize()
    Find upper bound using optimize
    volume_to_litres()
    Converting volume in cm3 to litres
